thread.title: Fish and chip shop may get a Michelin star after win as best British chippie attracts guide inspectors - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Fish and chip shop may get a Michelin star after win as best British chippie attracts guide inspectors - Mirror Online

author: Nick Dorman
title: Fish and chip shop may get a Michelin star after win as best British chippie attracts guide inspectors - Mirror Online
text:
News Fish and chip shop may get a Michelin star after win as best British chippie attracts guide inspectors Kingfisher Fish and Chips was last week named Britain’s best chippie - and is now bracing itself for a visit from the elite team behind high end dining bible Share The produce on offer at Kingfisher Fish and Chips which will be judged by Michelin inspectors Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A fish and chip shop is to be visited by Michelin inspectors and could get one of the guide's world famous stars. 
Kingfisher Fish and Chips was last week named Britain’s best chippie - and is now bracing itself for a visit from the elite team behind high end dining bible. 
Representatives will sample the eateries’ battered cod - and lobster - when they visit Plymouth, Devon. 
Kingfisher last month won the Independent Takeaway Fish and Chip Shop gong. Kingfisher Fish and Chips owners Craig Maw and partner Nikki Mutton are preparing for a visit from Michelin inspectors 
But now its eat in restaurant could scoop a Michelin, like dining establishments run by TV chefs Heston Blumenthal and Michel Roux Junior. 
Michelin said: “We are aware of this establishment and our inspectors are taking it into consideration when they visit Plymouth.” 
The inspection team will judge the chippie on quality of ingredients, chefs’ technical flair, "clarity of flavours" and "menu balance". Read More Price of fish and chips set to rocket as Britain's supply of fresh cod and hadddock is threatened by striking Icelandic fishermen Craig Maw with partner Nikki Mutton after their recent win (Photo: Collect Unknown) 
The chippie offers thirteen different kinds of fish, ranging from traditional cod and haddock to local Cornish hake, sardine fish cakes and lobster. 
A large cod and chips comes in at £8.55. Jumbo battered sausages are £1.75 steak and jkidney pies £2.50, pea fritters £1.45 and pickled eggs 60p each. 
Craig Maw, who runs Kingfisher with partner Nikki Mutton, said: “Neither of us have ever eaten in a Michelin starred restaurant but we’re delighted Michelin are considering us. Read More Birds Eye sneakily shrinks fish finger packs offering shoppers LESS - but the price remains the same 
“Perhaps it’s about time the fish and chip industry got this level of recognition, many of us have balanced being a traditional chippie with modernising our menus, you don’t just get cod and haddock now. 
“Demand for different species of fish means that many chip shops are serving exquisite dishes, and we are known for our lobster and chips.” The Kingfisher menu
